summary: This bill, the Palliative Care and Hospice Education and Training Act, aims to improve palliative care and hospice services in the United States. It does so by increasing the number of faculty specializing in palliative care at medical and nursing schools, providing grants for education and training programs for health professionals, and encouraging research in the field. The bill also provides funding for career incentive awards and creates programs to disseminate information about palliative care.
